member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl
member.summary: Defines a base class for custom controls that support scrolling behavior.
member.remarks:
The ScrollControl class acts as a base class for controls that require the ability to scroll. To allow a control to display scroll bars as needed, set the AutoScroll property to true. To select which scroll bars should be visible, set the VScroll and HScroll properties.
You can also associate stand-alone scrollbars with the ScrollControl. The VertScrollBar and HorizScrollBar properties allow you to associate external scrollbars. This is of benefit if you want to share one scrollbar with a parent control. For example, if the ScrollControl is a view inside a workbook or dynamic splitter frame.
ScrollControl supports automatic scrolling when the user drags the mouse. In a grid when the user starts selecting cells the user can drag the mouse outside the grid area and the grid will automatically scroll. To enable auto scrolling, override the OnMouseDown event in your derived control and initialize the AutoScrolling, AutoScrollBounds and InsideScrollBounds properties.
When the user scrolls your control and holds down the mouse on the down or up arrow of the scrollbar, the scrolling speed will accelerate.
The FixRenderOrigin method will ensure correct initialization of the rendering origin for brushes and patterns. You can call FixRenderOrigin from your control's OnPaint method. ScrollControl supports scrolling with the mouse wheel and also cooperates fine with with the IntelliMouseDragScroll class.
If you want to provide context information about your control and change the cursor on the fly while the user moves the mouse, set the OverrideCursor property to the cursor you want to show. Instead you can also implement IMouseController and add the object to MouseControllerDispatcher.

member.returns: true if you should invalidate areas that need to be redrawn; false if a complete Refresh for the control is pending and therefore invalidating the view is not necessary.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.ShouldPrepareUpdate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method to check if you should do any update calculations for the view in your control and to notify scrollcontrol that the controls content need to be updated.
member.param: If markPaintPending is true ScrollControl will assume the control needs to be repainted in a subsequent EndUpdate call.
member.returns: true if you should Invalidate regions to be repainted in your control. It will return false if a complete Refresh of the control is pending and you don't need to invalidate individual regions of your control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Suspends the painting of the control until the method is called.
member.remarks: When many paint are made to the appearance of a control you should invoke the BeginUpdate method to temporarily freeze the drawing of the control. This results in less distraction to the user, and a performance gain. After all updates have been made, invoke the EndUpdate method to resume drawing of the control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.BeginUpdate(Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.BeginUpdateOptions)
member.summary: Suspends the painting of the control until the method is called.
member.param: Specifies the painting support during the BeginUpdate, EndUpdate batch.
member.remarks:
When many paint are made to the appearance of a control you should invoke the BeginUpdate method to temporarily freeze the drawing of the control. This results in less distraction to the user, and a performance gain. After all updates have been made, invoke the EndUpdate method to resume drawing of the control.
Pass BeginUpdateOptions if you do not want to do a complete Refresh of the control and instead want to have certain regions of your control be invalidated or scroll the contents of control. If you call BeginUpdate() and then later EndUpdate() the control will know if a paint is pending and only refresh the control if a paint is pending. Either call to ShouldPrepareUpdate, Invalidate or a WM_PAINT message during the BeginUpdate EndUpdate block will signal the control that a paint is pending.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.EndUpdate
member.summary: Resumes the painting of the control suspended by calling the BeginUpdate method.
member.remarks: When many paint are made to the appearance of a control you should invoke the BeginUpdate method to temporarily freeze the drawing of the control. This results in less distraction to the user, and a performance gain. After all updates have been made, invoke the EndUpdate method to resume drawing of the control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.CancelUpdate
member.summary: Cancels any prior calls.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.EndUpdate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resumes the painting of the control suspended by calling the BeginUpdate method.
member.remarks: When many paint are made to the appearance of a control you should invoke the BeginUpdate method to temporarily freeze the drawing of the control. This results in less distraction to the user, and a performance gain. After all updates have been made, invoke the EndUpdate method to resume drawing of the control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.ScrollWindow(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Scrolls the contents of the control similar to the ScrollWindow Windows API.
member.remarks:
The method will raise a WindowScrolling event before the contents are scrolled and a WindowScrolled event after the contents have been scrolled.
If DisableScrollWindow is true any calls to the ScrollWindow method will simply invalidate the affect region. The rendering origin will still be recorded correctly and WindowScrolling and WindowScrolled events will be raised.
If DisableScrollWindow is false ScrollWindow will scroll the contents of the control.

member.summary: Determines if this control contains focus. Override this method if you want to show dropdown windows and indicate the control has not lost focus when the dropdown is shown.
member.returns: true if the control or any child control has focus; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.DiscardPaintMessagesAfterBeginUpdate
member.summary: When you call BeginUpdate() the control by default does not handle WM_PAINT messages. Only once you call EndUpdate they will be processed. If this causes problems in your application, you can set this static property to true. In such cases WM_PAINT messages will be simply discarded and any invalid regions will be validated.
member.remarks:
There is a problem with the default implementation of BeginUpdate. If a screen region is marked invalid the WndProc will be repeatedly called with WM_PAINT at the the top of the WndProc until EndUpdate is called. This can cause your application to freeze if another window gets created or if you make a web service call and WndProc messages need to be processed.
Setting DiscardPaintMessagesAfterBeginUpdate = true will help avoid these scenarios.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ScrollControl.DisableScrollWindow
member.summary: Lets you check or specify the setting if the window should be scrolled when ScrollWindow is called.

remarks.para: If DisableScrollWindow is true any calls to the ScrollWindow method will simply invalidate the affect region. The rendering origin will still be recorded correctly and WindowScrolling and WindowScrolled events will be raised.
If DisableScrollWindow is false ScrollWindow will scroll the contents of the control.
If DisableScrollWindow will return true if BeginUpdate was called without the BeginUpdateOptions.ScrollWindow option.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager
member.summary: Provides a global hook for exceptions that have been catched inside the framework and gives you the option to provide specialized handling of the exception. You can also temporarily suspend and resume catching exceptions.
member.remarks:
The Syncfusion framework notifies about exceptions that are catched by calling ExceptionManager.RaiseExceptionCatched or ExceptionManager. The RaiseExceptionCatched method will raise the ExceptionCatched event. By handling the ExceptionCatched event your code can analyze the exception that was catched and optionally let it bubble up by rethrowing the exception.
Your code can also temporariliy suspend and resume catching exceptions. This is usefull if you want to provide your own exception handling. Just call to disable handling exceptions and to resume catching exceptions.
You also have the options to disable catching exceptions alltogether by setting to true.
Note: All static settings for this class are thread local.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.SuspendCatchExceptions
member.summary: Temporariliy suspend and resume catching exceptions. Call to disable handling exceptions and to resume catching exceptions.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.ResumeCatchExceptions
member.summary: Temporariliy suspend and resume catching exceptions. Call to disable handling exceptions and to resume catching exceptions.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.ShouldCatchExceptions
member.summary: Determines if exceptions should be catched or if they should bubble up. calls this method.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.ExceptionManager.PassThroughExceptions
member.summary: Lets you disable catching exceptions alltogether by setting to true.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem
member.summary: Interface, that must be supported by lexem configurations. It describes behaviour of the lexem, that can be collapsed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.IsCollapsable
member.summary: GET checks whether this config supports collapsing.
member.remarks: If lexem is not collapsabe, all other properties does not have any influence to it`s behaviour.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.IsCollapseAutoNamed
member.summary: GET flag, that specifies, whether lexem can read it`s text from sub-lexems.

remarks.para: If this property is false, then CollapseName will be used to name the region.

Note: you should know that is this property is true, then on by-lexem reading you`ll have to wait while sub-lexems will be loaded, then processed by RegEx and only then you`ll have your collapsible lexem.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.AutoNameExpression
member.summary: Expression for auto-naming.
member.remarks: When parsing collapsed region, parser reads text from stream until text matches given expression. You can specifie different named groups here to use them later in AutoNameTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.AutoNameTemplate
member.summary: Template of resulting text for auto-naming of collapse.
member.remarks: To specifie "$" symbol you must use $$. To use result of some named group, use ${name}.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.AutoNameRegex
member.summary: Regular expression instance for AutoNameExpression.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.ICollapsableConfigLexem.CollapseName
member.summary: Name of the collapsed region.
member.remarks: If is true, then this property`s value will be used just when found name is empty.

member.summary: Gets or sets template of resulting text for auto-naming of collapse.

member.summary: Gets regular expression instance for AutoNameExpression.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.ConfigLexem.IsCollapseAutoNamed
member.summary: Gets flag that specifies whether name of the collapsed region lexem should read by itself.

remarks.para: If this property is false, CollapseName will be used to name the region.

Note: you should know that if this property is true, then on by-lexem reading you'll have to wait while sub-lexems will be loaded, then processed by RegEx, and only then you'll have your collapsible lexem.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.ConfigLexem.CollapseName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the collapsed region.
member.remarks: If is true, then this property's value will be used only when found name is empty.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.LexemConfigsKeeper.#ctor(Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.IConfigLexem)
member.summary: Creates and initializes new instance of the class by config`s data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Implementation.Config.LexemConfigsKeeper.GetConfigs(System.String)
member.summary: Looks for lexem configuration by the token.
member.remarks: Search process is entirely based on rules, specified by owner lexem configuration. If owner is complex, search is done within it`s sub-lexems first, then it is done for its parent and so on. If there is no appropriate configuration for given token found, languages configuration is used, or the configuration of the first parent with "OnlyLocalSubLexems" set to true.

member.summary: Structure, used to keep information about one priority.

member.summary: Regular expression, that contains all reg-exps.

If both properties Background and Foreground set to not Empty value then for drawing used hatch brush according to BackStyle property value. If Foreground set to Color.Empty value then will be filled snippet rectangle by Background color.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Interfaces.IBackgroundFormat.HatchStyle

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues
member.summary: Values to pass to the GetDCEx method.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.Window
member.summary: DCX_WINDOW: Returns a DC that corresponds to the window rectangle rather than the client rectangle.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.Cache
member.summary: DCX_CACHE: Returns a DC from the cache, rather than the OWNDC or CLASSDC window. Essentially overrides CS_OWNDC and CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.NoResetAttrs
member.summary: DCX_NORESETATTRS: Does not reset the attributes of this DC to the default attributes when this DC is released.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.ClipChildren
member.summary: DCX_CLIPCHILDREN: Excludes the visible regions of all child windows below the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.ClipSiblings
member.summary: DCX_CLIPSIBLINGS: Excludes the visible regions of all sibling windows above the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.ParentClip
member.summary: DCX_PARENTCLIP: Uses the visible region of the parent window. The parent's WS_CLIPCHILDREN and CS_PARENTDC style bits are ignored. The origin is set to the upper-left corner of the window identified by hWnd.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeRgn
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDERGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is excluded from the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.IntersectRgn
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTRGN: The clipping region identified by hrgnClip is intersected with the visible region of the returned DC.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.ExcludeUpdate
member.summary: DCX_EXCLUDEUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.IntersectUpdate
member.summary: DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE: Unknown...Undocumented

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.LockWindowUpdate
member.summary: DCX_LOCKWINDOWUPDATE: Allows drawing even if there is a LockWindowUpdate call in effect that would otherwise exclude this window. Used for drawing during tracking.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.DeviceContextValues.Validate
member.summary: DCX_VALIDATE When specified with DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE, causes the DC to be completely validated. Using this function with both DCX_INTERSECTUPDATE and DCX_VALIDATE is identical to using the BeginPaint function.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI
member.summary: Summary description for Native.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.#ctor
member.summary: Hide default constructor

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.CreateCaret(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The CreateCaret function creates a new shape for the system caret and assigns ownership of the caret to the specified window. The caret shape can be a line, a block, or a bitmap.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that owns the caret.

[in] Handle to the bitmap that defines the caret shape. If this parameter is NULL, the caret is solid. If this parameter is (HBITMAP) 1, the caret is gray. If this parameter is a bitmap handle, the caret is the specified bitmap. The bitmap handle must have been created by the CreateBitmap, CreateDIBitmap, or LoadBitmap function. If hBitmap is a bitmap handle, CreateCaret ignores the nWidth and nHeight parameters; the bitmap defines its own width and height.

in] Specifies the width of the caret in logical units. If this parameter is zero, the width is set to the system-defined window border width. If hBitmap is a bitmap handle, CreateCaret ignores this parameter

[in] Specifies the height, in logical units, of the caret. If this parameter is zero, the height is set to the system-defined window border height. If hBitmap is a bitmap handle, CreateCaret ignores this parameter
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.DestroyCaret
member.summary: The DestroyCaret function destroys the caret's current shape, frees the caret from the window, and removes the caret from the screen.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.GetCaretBlinkTime
member.summary: Returns the time required to invert the caret's pixels. The user can set this value.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the blink time, in milliseconds. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.GetCaretPos(Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.POINT@)
member.summary: The GetCaretPos function copies the caret's position to the specified POINT structure
member.param: [out] Pointer to the POINT structure that is to receive the client coordinates of the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.HideCaret(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The HideCaret function removes the caret from the screen. Hiding a caret does not destroy its current shape or invalidate the insertion point.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that owns the caret. If this parameter is NULL, HideCaret searches the current task for the window that owns the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.SetCaretBlinkTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the caret blink time to the specified number of milliseconds. The blink time is the elapsed time, in milliseconds, required to invert the caret's pixels.
member.param: [in] Specifies the new blink time, in milliseconds.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.SetCaretPos(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: moves the caret to the specified coordinates. If the window that owns the caret was created with the CS_OWNDC class style, then the specified coordinates are subject to the mapping mode of the device context associated with that window
member.param: [in] Specifies the new x-coordinate of the caret.
[in] Specifies the new y-coordinate of the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.ShowCaret(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Makes the caret visible on the screen at the caret's current position. When the caret becomes visible, it begins flashing automatically
member.param: [in] Handle to the window that owns the caret. If this parameter is NULL, ShowCaret searches the current task for the window that owns the caret.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.CaretAPI.GetLastError
member.summary: Retrieves the calling thread's last-error code value. The last-error code is maintained on a per-thread basis. Multiple threads do not overwrite each other's last-error code.
member.returns: The return value is the calling thread's last-error code value. Functions set this value by calling the SetLastError function. The Return Value section of each reference page notes the conditions under which the function sets the last-error code.

Specifies the method of formatting the text.

member.summary: Copies the status of the 256 virtual keys to the specified buffer.
member.param: The 256-byte array that receives the status data for each virtual key.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.GetCurrentThreadId
member.summary: Gets ID of the current thread.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.HookProc,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.param: Specifies the type of hook procedure to be installed.
Delegate for the method that will process mesages.

Handle to the DLL containing the hook procedure pointed to by the lpfn parameter. The hMod parameter must be set to NULL if the dwThreadId parameter specifies a thread created by the current process and if the hook procedure is within the code associated with the current process.

Specifies the identifier of the thread with which the hook procedure is to be associated. If this parameter is zero, the hook procedure is associated with all existing threads running in the same desktop as the calling thread.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.UnhookWindowsHookEx(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Removes a hook procedure installed in a hook chain by the SetWindowsHookEx function.
member.param: Handle to the hook to be removed. This parameter is a hook handle obtained by a previous call to SetWindowsHookEx.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.CallNextHookEx(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The CallNextHookEx function passes the hook information to the next hook procedure in the current hook chain. A hook procedure can call this function either before or after processing the hook information.
member.param: Specifies the hook code passed to the current hook procedure. The next hook procedure uses this code to determine how to process the hook information.
Specifies the wParam value passed to the current hook procedure. The meaning of this parameter depends on the type of hook associated with the current hook chain.
Specifies the lParam value passed to the current hook procedure. The meaning of this parameter depends on the type of hook associated with the current hook chain.
member.returns: This value is returned by the next hook procedure in the chain. The current hook procedure must also return this value. The meaning of the return value depends on the hook type. For more information, see the descriptions of the individual hook procedures.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.GetAsyncKeyState(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: The GetAsyncKeyState function determines whether a key is up or down at the time the function is called, and whether the key was pressed after a previous call to GetAsyncKeyState.
member.param: Specifies one of 256 possible virtual-key codes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a child, pop-up, or top-level window. Child, pop-up, and top-level windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen. The topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.
member.param: Handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the Z order. This parameter must be a window handle or one of the following values.
Specifies the new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
Specifies the new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
Specifies the new width of the window, in pixels.
Specifies the new height of the window, in pixels.
Specifies the window sizing and positioning flags.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the specified window's show state.
member.param: Specifies how the window is to be shown. This parameter is ignored the first time an application calls ShowWindow, if the program that launched the application provides a STARTUPINFO structure. Otherwise, the first time ShowWindow is called, the value should be the value obtained by the WinMain function in its nCmdShow parameter.
member.returns: If the window was previously visible, the return value is nonzero. If the window was previously hidden, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.RedrawWindow(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Updates the specified rectangle or region in a window's client area.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.LockWindowUpdate(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Locks/unlocks window update.
member.param: Handle of the window that should be locked.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Forms.Edit.Utils.WinAPI.AttachThreadInput(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The AttachThreadInput function attaches or detaches the input processing mechanism of one thread to that of another thread.
member.param: Identifier of the thread to be attached to another thread. The thread to be attached cannot be a system thread.
Identifier of the thread to which idAttach will be attached. This thread cannot be a system thread. A thread cannot attach to itself. Therefore, idAttachTo cannot equal idAttach.
If this parameter is TRUE, the two threads are attached. If the parameter is FALSE, the threads are detached.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. There is no extended error information; do not call GetLastError.
